AsÂ aÂ Technical Leader, you will contribute toÂ Namecheap and Spaceship, driving innovation and excellence. Our organization leverages advanced Business Intelligence (BI) systems toÂ process approximately 100GB ofÂ data daily, with internal storage exceeding 100TB across various data types. title: Python Developer

description: Binariks  isÂ looking for aÂ highly motivated and skilled Middle/Senior Backend Engineer toÂ join the team About the project:  Clientâ€™s product isÂ anÂ enterprise-focused, secure, and user-friendly platform that allows organizations toÂ use multipleÂ AI models through aÂ single interface. ItÂ addresses challenges like security, compliance, cost, and vendor lock-in that organizations face when adopting large language models (LLMs). The product ensures data security and compliance (HIPAA, SEC) and offers real-time filtering, customizable prompts, and comprehensive audit trails for AIÂ interactions. What Weâ€™re Looking For 5+Â years ofÂ development experience inÂ anÂ agile/scrum environment Strong knowledge ofÂ common Computer Science and Programming language theory Good Knowledge ofÂ Python Understanding ofÂ requirements developments. Desire and ability toÂ understand how things work inÂ aÂ specific domain Advanced algorithms and data structures Knowledge ofÂ Python libs: Pandas, SciPy, Sklearn, PyTorch, TensorFlow, FastAPI, Streamlight, asyncio, and others Knowledge ofÂ PostgreSQLÂ & ORMâ€™s like Peewee Experience with OpenAIÂ / LangchainÂ / llama indexÂ / other LLMs-related things Experience with Data Analytics Understanding ofÂ LLM agent development principles &Â methodologies Upper-intermediate level ofÂ spoken and written English Your Responsibilities Develop and maintain core software components using Python Collaborate with the engineering team toÂ design and implement effective software solutions Contribute toÂ system and test engineering activities Participate inÂ code reviews and provide constructive feedback Troubleshoot and debug software issues Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code Assist inÂ defining and documenting software requirements and specifications Work closely with cross-functional teams toÂ achieve project goals Contribute toÂ continuous improvement ofÂ development processes and tools Stay updated onÂ emerging technologies and apply them toÂ projects asÂ necessary
title: Senior Backend Engineer (Python)

description: WeÂ are looking for aÂ highly skilled and experienced Senior General QAÂ Engineer toÂ join our dynamic team. InÂ this role, you will beÂ instrumental inÂ ensuring the quality and reliability ofÂ our complex web and mobile travel applications. You will work closely with product management, development, and operations teams toÂ understand project requirements, define test strategies, and execute comprehensive testing plans. Your expertise will beÂ crucial inÂ maintaining the high standards ofÂ our software products, contributing toÂ our mission ofÂ delivering exceptional travel solutions. What You Will BeÂ Doing: Helping toÂ test complex web and mobile travel applications. Collaborating withÂ PM and Team Lead toÂ understand project requirements and objectives. Participating inÂ test planning activities and contributing toÂ the development ofÂ test strategies and test plans. Designing and executing test cases toÂ verify software functionality and usability. Conducting various types ofÂ testing, including functional testing (UI/API), regression testing, and integration testing. Identifying, reporting, and tracking defects using appropriate tools and methodologies. Writing and maintaining comprehensive test documentation, including test plans, test cases, bug reports, and sporadic internal knowledge base articles (e.g., Confluence). Taking aÂ direct part inÂ the discussion and planning ofÂ new features with TPM and Team Lead, alongside the creation ofÂ corresponding test plans. Planning and executing manual testing where automated tests doÂ not provide sufficient coverage. Performing ad-hoc and exploratory testing for areas that require immediate attention orÂ have high-risk user scenarios that are not covered byÂ automated tests. Striving for the highest possible test coverage with automated tests, including overseeing the sufficiency and coverage atÂ all levels. Collaborating with developers toÂ ensure that unit and component tests are well-integrated. Writing and maintaining automated tests atÂ the integration and end-to-end levels. You Certainly: Have aÂ passion for quality and great attention toÂ detail. Possess 5+Â years ofÂ experience inÂ web application testing, including UI/API, functional/non-functional testing, and are familiar with the practices ofÂ regular product delivery and its testing inÂ this context. Have hands-on experience with exploratory testing. Have hands-on experience with API testing tools such asÂ Postman, Swagger, and Curl. Have experience with creating and maintaining test documentation beyond just bug reports and test cases. Are able toÂ write clear, easy-to-follow bug reports, checklists, and feature requests. Are familiar with basic programming principles and have aÂ conceptual knowledge ofÂ modern software engineering processes, including version control systems, issue tracking, and continuous integration. Have experience running automation tests and analyzing reports. Have excellent English communication skills, both written and spoken. Are self-motivated, proactive, and able toÂ multitask, prioritize your work, and deliver onÂ time, with aÂ desire for continuous improvement. BeÂ aÂ plus: Have experience with testing travel products. Have experience troubleshooting issues using tools like Splunk and Sentry. Who WeÂ Are: WeÂ are aÂ tech team ofÂ adventurous travelers who were once part ofÂ YCombinator alumniâ€”GetGoing Inc., founded inÂ 2012 byÂ Harvard, Stanford, and Berkeley graduates. WeÂ also raised ~$10M inÂ venture capital from Silicon Valley. InÂ 2016, weÂ joined BCD Travel ( www.bcdtravel.com ), aÂ global corporate travel management company with annual sales ofÂ $25Â billion, toÂ bring our unique hotel booking technology toÂ BCD Travelâ€™s products. What WeÂ Do: The product weÂ develop isÂ aÂ B2B booking platform for business trips, which helps users book hotels, flights, and cars. ItÂ provides both business travelers and their travel agents with detailed itineraries and the best booking options. Every day, thousands ofÂ business travelers across the world use our software built onÂ modern technology. WeÂ Use: OnÂ the front end: ES6 and React/Redux. OnÂ the backend: PythonÂ 3. For automation: Python3, Selenium Webdriver, Behave, Pytest, Playwright, Appium, Jenkins, Docker, Locust, etc.

description: WeÂ are seeking aÂ talented Middle Fullstack (Python + React) Engineer toÂ join our dynamic team. What isÂ this project about?  This isÂ aÂ Fintech project from theÂ US, whose main goal isÂ toÂ manage and schedule debts forÂ US customers using aÂ popular payment system. The digital collection strategy allows clients toÂ pay atÂ their own pace onÂ aÂ customizable plan that works for them. The customers have aÂ proprietary online portal toÂ manage their accounts. The platform offers them multiple installment payment options, nearly instant account updates, and even potential discounts for many accounts. What isÂ soÂ great about this project? InÂ the last two years, the client has successfully found their product-market fit, which means theyâ€™ve now identified their target customers and are set for further growth. Their recent decision toÂ expand the team byÂ adding two more engineers isÂ aÂ solid indicator ofÂ confidence inÂ the future ofÂ their business. Additionally, the client prefers long-term relationships with team members, rarely making changes, which reflects their focus onÂ building aÂ strong, lasting team dynamic. Who are the people IÂ am going toÂ work with?   Our team consists ofÂ 2Â Fullstack, 1Â BE, 1Â FE Engineers, 2Â QAs, DevOps, Designer, and PM. What does the interview process look like? â€”Â Interview with the RecruiterÂ â€” upÂ toÂ 30Â min.; â€”Â Technical interviewÂ â€” upÂ toÂ 1Â h. Requirements:  â€¢ AtÂ least 3Â years ofÂ experience with Python; â€¢ Hands-on experience with Django; â€¢ Experience with React would beÂ aÂ strong plus; â€¢ Experience with relational and non-relational databases; â€¢ Understanding ofÂ AWS services (S3); â€¢ Experience with microservices architecture; â€¢ Experience with Celery; â€¢ AtÂ least Upper-Intermediate English. Responsibilities: â€¢ Writing stable well-tested software; â€¢ Taking part inÂ requirements analysis, task planning, estimation, coding; â€¢ Maintaining clean code and other best practices; â€¢ Ensuring the code tests coverage; â€¢ Suggesting technical and functional improvements for the project; â€¢ Maintaining close collaboration with other team members.

description: WeÂ are seeking aÂ motivated and skilled Full Stack Engineer toÂ join our dynamic team. AsÂ aÂ Full Stack Engineer, you will play aÂ crucial role inÂ designing, developing, and maintaining scalable web applications. Requirements: 5+Â years ofÂ experience building web applications. Proficiency inÂ Python, TypeScript, React, Remix, and AWS. Strong understanding ofÂ serverless architecture and DevOps practices. Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills. Ability toÂ work independently and asÂ part ofÂ aÂ team. AÂ passion for learning and staying up-to-date with the latest tech. Upper orÂ Fluent English. Responsibilities: Design, develop, and maintain robust and scalable web applications using Python, TypeScript, and frameworks like React and Remix. Collaborate with cross-functional teams toÂ deliver high-quality products. Implement best practices for software development, including version control, testing, and deployment. Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry trends. WeÂ offer: Ğ¡ompetitive compensation based onÂ your skills and experience. 24Â days ofÂ annual paid vacation and 5Â sick leaves. Accounting asÂ aÂ service. Long-term employment. Final feedback received within  2-4  days ofÂ interview. Please send yourÂ CV inÂ English along with your salary expectations ifÂ you are aÂ good match for this position.

description:
Letâ€™s breathe life into great tech ideas! With more than 3Â 000 people globally, Intellias isÂ aÂ company where benchmark technological solutions are born. Join inÂ and take your part inÂ digitalizing the world. What project weÂ have for you Extract scenes from the real world allowing top automotive companies toÂ simulate their autonomous driving solutions. 

 What you will do Participate inÂ the development, and maintenance ofÂ Python applications.  Troubleshoot and debug applications toÂ resolve issues.  Write clean, efficient, and self-documented code.  Implement automation tests.  Collaborate with team members toÂ identify and solve technical problems.  Participate inÂ code reviews toÂ ensure code quality and maintainability.  Work with stakeholders toÂ gather and analyze requirements and provide technical solutions.  Monitor application performance and provide optimization recommendations.  Stay upÂ toÂ date with the latest technologies and industry trends.  

 What you need for this 6+Â years ofÂ experience working asÂ aÂ Python Engineer orÂ inÂ aÂ similar role.  Strong proficiency inÂ Python programming and knowledge ofÂ object-oriented programming principles.  Solid understanding ofÂ algorithms and data structures.  Experience with OpenSearchÂ / Elastic Search i.e. Understanding how the indexâ€™s works and how the layer are stitched together, also how toÂ create schemas. Experience inÂ Prompt Engineering toÂ maintain, enhance orÂ modify the prompts used for AWS Bedrock. Proficiency inÂ ETL, protobuf.  Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS).  Experience with APIÂ Gateway, Lambdaâ€™s, Step-Functions. Proficiency inÂ version control systems, particularly Git.  Knowledge ofÂ Agile methodologies, such asÂ Scrum, and experience working inÂ Agile teams.  Strong problem-solving skills and the ability toÂ debug and optimize code.  Excellent communication and teamwork skills, with the ability toÂ collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.  Will beÂ aÂ plus: Experience with HDLive maps, Open Drive, etc.

WeÂ welcome and celebrate the differences ofÂ all qualified applicants. Join Intellias for aÂ career where your unique perspectives are not only valued but crucial toÂ our success.

title: Python Developer

description: AsÂ aÂ python developer and monetization lead, you will drive the development and communication around monetizing aÂ cutting-edge product suite ofÂ AI based services. You will collaborate with technical teams and business partners toÂ maximize the value delivered toÂ users through API and backend functionalities Key Responsibilities Lead the development ofÂ APIs and related functionalities using Python, focusing onÂ delivering value toÂ end users. Provide expert technical support toÂ validators looking toÂ monetize their infrastructure. Track, analyze, and report onÂ APIÂ usage, product adoption, and monetization performance. Communicate effectively with internal teams and external partners, generating technical reports and addressing stakeholder inquiries. Required Skills &Â Qualifications Proven expertise inÂ Python, with experience with API development and backend systems. Experience with monetization strategies for software platforms.particularly within decentralized networks (blockchain, AIÂ inference, etc.). Strong communication skills, capable ofÂ creating technical reports and engaging with customers and partners. Passion for emerging technologies, such asÂ blockchain andÂ AI, with demonstrated problem-solving abilities and adaptability. Bonus Qualifications Experience with AIÂ development, MLÂ engineering orÂ working with AI-driven systems. Familiarity with web3, blockchain and/or decentralised networks. Familiarity monetization techniques for digital services. Experience with devops and cloud deployment IfÂ youâ€™re passionate about emerging tech and monetization strategies, weÂ want toÂ hear from you!

Our team embodies diverse experience inÂ IT technologies, big data, science, machine learning, and data processing. What weÂ are looking for: WeÂ are recruiting onÂ anÂ exclusive basis for aÂ Python Developer toÂ join our development team. OpenWeather has already established relations with more than 6Â million customers, and weÂ are now looking for aÂ colleague who will beÂ ableÂ to: â€”Â Design, develop and maintain new and existing Python code inÂ accordance with the coding standards and best practices inÂ one ofÂ the development teams (high-loaded services &Â APIs, pipelines for loading and processing data, internal analytical tools) â€”Â Support the product releases â€”Â Investigate issues when necessary Essential skills: â€”Â Experience inÂ backend applications (2 + years)  â€”Â Experience inÂ Python (sanic, FastAPI, aiohttp)  â€”Â Knowledge ofÂ Linux, Git, Docker, REST API â€”Â Technical English Would beÂ aÂ benefit: â€”Â Knowledge one ofÂ additional languages vÂ Node.js, Golang, PHP â€”Â Work with distributed scalable and high-loaded systems â€”Â Experience inÂ asynchronous task queues qÂ RabbitMQ, Celery, Airflow) â€”Â Experience inÂ NoSQLÂ or in-memory databases qÂ MongĞ¾DB, Cassandra, Redis) â€”Â Experience inÂ tools for runtime monitoring and debugging qÂ StatsD, Grafana, Sentry)  â€”Â Participating inÂ pet projects, open-source projects â€”Â Having aÂ GitHub profile Soft skills: â€”Â Exceptional attention toÂ detail â€”Â AÂ polite, friendly, and diplomatic manner

description: Sprinterra invites you toÂ beÂ aÂ part ofÂ our friendly and intelligent team. WeÂ develop various and diverse projects and have expertise inÂ many technologies. WeÂ create environment for growth and development ofÂ your skills and knowledge area. Job Description:   WeÂ are looking for anÂ experienced Python Developer toÂ join the Fintech project. Our project isÂ aÂ financial planning platform designed toÂ help businesses manage their budgets and cash flow effectively. This solution allows companies toÂ connect their bank accounts and payment systems, import and categorise transactions, analyse revenue and expense patterns, manage invoices, plan short- and long-term business strategies, consolidate financial data and prepare reporting for banks and other interested parties. The developer will work closely with our team toÂ design, develop, and maintain scalable and high-performance solutions for the project. The ideal candidate should have strong Python development skills, experience working with RESTful APIs, and aÂ solid understanding ofÂ cloud environments. Project Technologies and Tools: Development process isÂ managed inÂ accordance with Agile (Scrum) methodologies. Technologies used: Python/Django forÂ BE and Angular for FE. Key Responsibilities: Design, develop, and maintain Python-based solutions. Collaborate with the team toÂ ensure seamless integration and optimal performance. Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code. Participate inÂ code reviews and contribute toÂ aÂ culture ofÂ quality and continuous improvement. Optimize applications for performance and scalability. Troubleshoot and resolve issues inÂ production environments. Requirements: 3+Â years experience inÂ Python (preferably Django). Experience working with RESTful APIs and microservices architecture. Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP orÂ Azure) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes). Solid understanding ofÂ databases (SQL, NoSQL) and data modeling. Experience with version control (Git orÂ Bitbucket) and CI/CDÂ pipelines. Strong communication skills. Good communication level ofÂ English.

description: Requirements: â€”Â 3+Â years ofÂ Python experience; â€”Â Experience inÂ developing applications using LLM (Large Language Models); â€”Â Experience inÂ building applications based onÂ RAG; â€”Â Proficiency with popular libraries such asÂ Hugging Face Transformers, LangChain, OpenAIÂ API, Torch, and Haystack; â€”Â Proficiency with FastAPI for creating asynchronous APIs; â€”Â Knowledge and experience with databases: PostgreSQL and Redis; â€”Â Experience with Docker orÂ Podman for containerization; â€”Â Familiarity with Git and CI/CD; â€”Â Proficiency inÂ building unit tests; â€”Â Intermediate level ofÂ English. Would beÂ aÂ plus: â€”Â Familiarity with Pinecone, Weaviate, Faiss, orÂ similar solutions for storing and retrieving vector data; â€”Â Hands-on experience with spaCy, NLTK, and Gensim for tokenization, sentiment analysis, and text processing; â€”Â Mentoring junior developers experience. About the project:   Epicflow isÂ anÂ advanced, web-based project management solution tailored for multi-project management. ByÂ focusing onÂ resource availability, Epicflow optimizes workflow efficiency. The tool enhances the capabilities ofÂ widely used platforms, including MSÂ Project, Jira, TOPdesk, Primavera, and Trimergo, taking project management toÂ the next level. WeÂ offer:   â€”Â Monday-Friday, 9â€”18/10â€”19 working schedule; â€”Â Work from office/remote/mix; â€”Â Medical insurance; â€”Â NoÂ time trackers and other manifestations ofÂ bureaucracy; â€”Â Paid days off and sick days; â€”Â Gifts for birthdays and professional holidays; â€”Â The ability toÂ test your ideas, lead initiatives, and try something new and interesting; â€”Â Communication with experienced specialists willing toÂ share their knowledge; â€”Â Participation inÂ internal and external events, the opportunity toÂ build orÂ promote your brand.

title: Senior Python Engineer

description:
About you: WeÂ are looking for aÂ Full-Stack Developer with aÂ back-end focus toÂ join anÂ impactful project dedicated toÂ enhancing agriculture inÂ developing countries. This role involves developing aÂ mobile application MVP designed toÂ optimize agricultural practices through innovative data collection and phenotyping methods. You will play aÂ crucial part inÂ designing user-friendly interfaces and robust backend systems, ensuring reliable data handling, storage, and processing within resource-constrained environments. About project: This project aims toÂ develop aÂ mobile application MVP that will support agriculture byÂ enabling efficient data collection and real-time analysis. Built specifically for developing countries, the app will utilize innovative phenotyping techniques through smartphone-based imagery toÂ monitor and improve agricultural productivity. ByÂ capturing and processing visual data, the application provides essential insights that help farmers make data-driven decisions, ultimately improving crop yields and resource use. This solution isÂ tailored for resource-constrained environments, ensuring ease ofÂ use and scalability. The project holds immense potential toÂ create aÂ positive impact onÂ agricultural sustainability inÂ developing regions. 

 Your area ofÂ responsibility: Develop responsive UIÂ components, ensuring aÂ seamless user experience for farmers and stakeholders; Build and maintain scalable backend systems for effective data collection and processing; Design APIs for integration with various hardware and software components inÂ the agriculture sector; Implement data validation and quality control mechanisms toÂ guarantee data integrity and reliability; Optimize application performance for low-resource environments and conduct thorough testing for scalability and robustness; Conduct regular testing and quality assurance activities toÂ ensure the reliability and robustness ofÂ the software solution. Skills and requirements: AtÂ least 3+Â years ofÂ proven experience asÂ aÂ Full Stack Developer orÂ inÂ aÂ similar role; Experience orÂ knowledge ofÂ building app; Strong experience with Python (3+Â years); Strong experience with JavaScript (3+Â years); Experience inÂ atÂ least one major front-end framework, such asÂ React/Angular/Vue.js; Strong experience with HTML, CSS; Proficiency inÂ API development and integration (Restful API); Strong experience with SQL; Experience inÂ cloud services (Google Cloud Platform, AWS, orÂ Azure); Experience with app cloud integration; Skilled inÂ end-to-end testing, including unit and integration testing, toÂ ensure software reliability and robustness. Will beÂ aÂ plus: Experience with GCP (Google Cloud Platform) orÂ aÂ strong willingness toÂ learnÂ it; Knowledge ofÂ machine learning frameworks orÂ computer vision algorithms, especially asÂ they relate toÂ agricultural orÂ environmental data; Familiarity with working inÂ resource-constrained environments, optimizing for efficiency and performance inÂ challenging conditions. WeÂ offer: Working inÂ aÂ team ofÂ talented and passionate engineers; Opportunity toÂ work with the most trending technologies; Long-term enjoyable cooperation; Personal legal support; Payable vacation and sick days; Competitive salary depending onÂ your own talents; Regular performance &Â career development reviews; Team building events.
title: Full-Stack Developer (Back-end oriented)

description: AsÂ one ofÂ the world leaders inÂ the cybersecurity space, OpenVPN isÂ looking for aÂ senior systems and software engineer with aÂ strong working knowledge ofÂ Python and databases. The ideal candidate will possess aÂ solid conceptual foundation inÂ the development ofÂ client-server software with anÂ emphasis onÂ network routing, load balancing, secure APIs, congestion control, reliability, performance monitoring, and reporting. The candidate should have 5Â or more years ofÂ programming experience, preferably onÂ Linux server environments. Also, your proactive attitude and the ability toÂ assume responsibility, take ownership, and work independently are more important toÂ your success inÂ this position. WeÂ are the team that created OpenVPN, the industry-standard VPN protocol now used byÂ most commercial VPN providers worldwide. You will play aÂ key role inÂ aÂ team developing OpenVPN Access Server, our full-featured business VPN solution that accommodates aÂ wide range ofÂ configurations, including remote access, site-to-site VPNs, and enterprise-scale remote access solutions with load balancing, failover, and fine-grained access controls. Our team isÂ aÂ great fit for those who value self-organization and are passionate about personal growth. IfÂ this resonates with you, weâ€™d love toÂ have you join the team.

Work with modern DevOps practices (AWX Ansible orÂ Terraform) toÂ maintain CI/CD pipelines and streamline deployments. Implement authentication and authorization mechanisms (e.g., OAuth2, JWT, Keycloak) toÂ ensure secure service interactions. This role will involve architecting and building secure and performant Python applications, working closely with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes, and integrating with various cloud and DevOps platforms. Your experience inÂ microservices and distributed systems will beÂ crucial inÂ migrating monolithic architectures toÂ microservice-driven systems. Right now, these marketplaces are mostly private individuals. WeÂ emphasized that this isÂ not aÂ classic standalone product, but aÂ set ofÂ tools like Chrome extension, different no-code solutions with automation, etc. There isÂ aÂ pilot version, which has been successfully released, and there isÂ aÂ big partner inÂ the US. IfÂ youâ€™re interested inÂ this opportunity, please let meÂ know and Iâ€™ll provide more information. IÂ look forward toÂ hearing back from you!

description: WeÂ are aÂ productÂ IT company with over 10Â years ofÂ product development experience. Now weÂ have launched the development ofÂ aÂ new product. InÂ this regard, weÂ are looking for aÂ Python  Developer/Data Scientist  for full-time, remote work toÂ work together toÂ create progressive products. WeÂ offer you inspiring challenges and complex tasks within anÂ ambitious product without unnecessary bureaucracy. Expectations from the candidate: Python development experience from 3Â years; WEB development experience (REST API); experience with Pandas, Numpy for working with data; practical experience with  ML-tasks  from aÂ year within aÂ real project; experience with NLP and CNN tasks. Job Requirements: Remote work inÂ aÂ friendly and comfortable team ofÂ professional developers WITHOUT the oppression ofÂ marketers; On-time salary starting from $5500Â gross; 2Â weeks paid holiday aÂ year; Paid sick days; Paid time off onÂ major Slavic holidays; Opportunity toÂ attend professional courses atÂ companyâ€™s expense; Working week: Sunday-Thursday, 10Â a.m.Â toÂ 7Â p.m. Israel time. description: Job Description: AsÂ the Senior Python Backend Developer, you will beÂ responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining aÂ high-load microservices architecture with aÂ focus onÂ reliability, scalability, and exceptional code quality. You will work closely with cross-functional teams toÂ ensure seamless integration and high availability, handling millions ofÂ transactions while maintaining robust system performance. This role demands expertise inÂ managing complex backend systems, optimizing performance under heavy load, and ensuring that the technical solutions align with high standards ofÂ quality and reliability.   Requirements:   6+Â years Experience inÂ Python backend development, particularly with high-load systems and scalable microservices; Strong expertise inÂ microservices architecture and technical patterns, with aÂ focus onÂ observability, logging (especially ELK stack), and proactive quality monitoring; Proficiency with one orÂ more frameworks such asÂ FastAPI, Tornado, AIOHTTP, Django, orÂ Flask; Experience with AI-tool for accelerating software engineering (Compilot, AWS QÂ for Dev); Advanced experience with relational and NoSQL databases (e.g., Postgres, Cassandra, MongoDB) and ORMs; Solid experience deploying containerized applications onÂ Kubernetes and Docker; Deep understanding ofÂ the SDLC, CI/CDÂ processes, and maintaining high code quality; Familiarity with Linux systems, command-line operations and troubleshooting solution; Proactive, goal and result oriented, open-minded, systematic thinker, and strong communication skills.   Key Responsibilities:   Architect, develop, and optimize high-load backend services and RESTful APIs, emphasizing performance and scalability; Implement and maintain aÂ robust microservices architecture that ensures high availability and efficient resource management under demanding loads; Drive quality standards through comprehensive observability and logging (especially with the ELK stack), proactive monitoring, and high-level troubleshooting; Collaborate with DevOps toÂ manage containerized deployments onÂ Kubernetes and Docker, ensuring seamless integration and smooth operation; Leverage frameworks such asÂ FastAPI, Tornado, AIOHTTP, Django, orÂ Flask toÂ build efficient, high-performing applications. Optimize relational (Postgres) and NoSQL (Cassandra, MongoDB) databases, utilizing ORMs for structured data handling and efficient retrieval; Establish best practices inÂ code quality, implementing CI/CDÂ pipelines, unit testing, and adhering toÂ the full SDLC; Work closely with other developers toÂ maintain coding standards, provide mentorship, and drive continuous improvement inÂ performance and quality.   What weÂ offer:   Career planning, regular performance review; Paid leave days; Free medical insurance; Sports reimbursement according toÂ Company HRÂ Policies; English lessons, speaking club; The company provides support inÂ the maintenance ofÂ all documentation for private entrepreneurs.

About you: 3+Â years ofÂ relevant Full Stack experience, experience ofÂ the web development, experience with AWS(S3, SQS, DocumentDB, EC2, ECS, Lambda), experience with Node.js, TypeScript and frameworks: Nest.js, Fastify, Express, experience with Frontend frameworks and libraries: React, Next.js, experience with NoSQLÂ DBs(MongoDB/CosmosDB/Redis), experience with RBDMS(Postgres/MySQL), experience with containers(Docker, Container services like ECS, Kubernetes), experience with analytics services integration, experience with CI/CD. AsÂ aÂ Rooshmate, you will have: â€”Â The coolest team ever You will join striving and open-minded professionals toÂ share ideas and shape the future. â€”Â Time-off policy toÂ take your time Twenty-one days ofÂ vacation, long and short-term sick leaves, compensatory days off, maternity and paternity leaves, and moreÂ â€” everything for you toÂ make upÂ your life according toÂ your needs. â€”Â Medical insurance Perfectly packed health care covering dental. â€”Â Boosting your expertise Weâ€™re interested inÂ accelerating your growthÂ â€” hence weÂ compensate for your professional development courses and conferences. Then weâ€™ll give you feedback, â€”Â call with your future Manager: weâ€™ll discuss the role and the project inÂ detail, â€”Â reference check: during the process, weâ€™ll contact your previous workplaces toÂ hear something even more exciting about you. Still not sure whether toÂ goÂ for Roosh orÂ not? Check our values toÂ resonate with yours first  here . Anyway, thanks for your interest. Weâ€™ll review yourÂ CV and everything you have sentÂ us within five working days. IfÂ your background meets our needsÂ â€” weâ€™ll set upÂ aÂ call toÂ get toÂ know each other better. Otherwise, weÂ arenâ€™t quite ready toÂ get along with you atÂ this moment. But noÂ worriesÂ â€” our journey has just started, and weâ€™d love toÂ stay inÂ touch asÂ our team grows and more opportunities emerge. WeÂ wish you the best ofÂ luck with your aspiration.

You probably:   â€”Â Have contributed toÂ anÂ open-source project â€”Â Have experience inÂ mentoring newcomers and leading small project groups â€”Â Have experience with Docker and K8s Who weÂ are:   WeÂ are aÂ tech team ofÂ adventurous travelers, who were once aÂ part ofÂ YCombinator alumniÂ â€” GetGoing Inc., founded inÂ 2012 byÂ Harvard, Stanford, and Berkeley graduates. InÂ 2016Â we joined BCD Travel ( www.bcdtravel.com ), aÂ global corporate travel management company with annual sales ofÂ $25Â billion, toÂ bring our unique technology ofÂ hotel booking toÂ BCD Travelâ€™s products. Cookies. â€”Â Conferences, workshops, certifications refund. â€”Â AÂ friendly, professional, and highly skilled team working with the newest technologies. â€”Â AÂ great office location inÂ the very center ofÂ Kyiv near metro stations Zoloti Vorota/ Teatralna/ Khreschatyk (weÂ have anÂ extra â€œcoffeeâ€ kitchen for coffee geeks, aÂ game zone with aÂ kicker and aÂ bomb shelter inÂ the building). â€”Â Flexible working hours and the ability toÂ choose between office, remote, orÂ aÂ mix ofÂ both. â€”Â 24Â working days ofÂ vacation + 6Â covered sick days. â€”Â AÂ chance toÂ help craft our tools, processes, and culture. â€”Â AÂ lab day once aÂ month toÂ dedicate toÂ aÂ project ofÂ your own orÂ aÂ study project. â€”Â Opportunities for career growth.

title: Python Engineer

description:
Numerical Technologies isÂ aÂ leading provider ofÂ custom software solutions and services specializing inÂ risk, limits, and regulatory capital. Right now, weÂ are looking for aÂ Python Developer toÂ join our team and contribute toÂ the adaptation and optimization ofÂ our systems due toÂ transition toÂ aÂ new, custom Graph Parallel Framework. This role involves working onÂ existing data pipelines, configurations, and API endpoints toÂ ensure they are optimized for performance and fully compatible with the new framework.   Key Responsibilities: Adapt and refactor existing data pipelines toÂ integrate seamlessly with the custom Graph Parallel Framework. Update and optimize configuration files toÂ support the new framework, ensuring smooth transitions without disrupting existing functionalities. Refactor and optimize API endpoints toÂ work efficiently within the newly structured pipelines. Focus onÂ maximizing system performance, with particular attention toÂ reducing execution time and optimizing memory usage. Work closely with cross-functional teams toÂ ensure the successful integration and deployment ofÂ the custom framework. 

   Qualifications: Solid experience inÂ Python development. Proficiency with SQL and experience working with databases, preferably ClickHouse. Strong understanding ofÂ algorithms and data structures. Experience with FastAPI and Linux environments. Ability toÂ adapt existing systems toÂ new frameworks and technologies. Strong problem-solving skills and ability toÂ collaborate effectively inÂ aÂ team environment. WeÂ offer:   â—¼ï¸ Competitive compensation depending onÂ experience and skills â—¼ï¸ Regular assessments and salary reviews â—¼ï¸ Paid personal days â—¼ï¸ Health insurance â—¼ï¸ Partial gym compensation â—¼ï¸ English/Polish/Spanish language classes â—¼ï¸ Flexible working schedule â—¼ï¸ Friendly team and enjoyable working environment

description: Intetics Inc,  aÂ leading global technology company providing custom software application development, distributed professional teams, software product quality assessment, and â€œall-things-digitalâ€ solutions, isÂ seeking aÂ talented Senior MLÂ Engineer toÂ join our team. Objective:  This project aims toÂ develop aÂ chatbot platform that serves asÂ aÂ centralized, trusted source ofÂ information for communities affected byÂ the crisis inÂ Ukraine. The chatbot will deliver critical, harmonized messages onÂ humanitarian assistance, including details onÂ cash and in-kind aid, fraud prevention, and contact information for relevant organizations. Key Features: Information Hub: The chatbot will provide affected individuals with access toÂ essential information regarding humanitarian assistance options and resources, available onÂ popular platformsÂ â€” Telegram and Viber. User-Centric Design: Built toÂ support both Ukrainian and English languages, the chatbot will include accessibility features for users with disabilities and will cater toÂ aÂ diverse audience, targeting upÂ toÂ 200,000 users inÂ the first year. Scalability and Security: Hosted onÂ aÂ secure, scalable cloud infrastructure, the platform will implement robust security measures toÂ protect user interactions and data. Content Management System (CMS): AÂ custom CMS will enable non-technical staff toÂ manage and update content, ensuring the chatbot remains current and relevant. Analytics and Monitoring: The platform will include aÂ dashboard toÂ monitor usage and user engagement, allowing continuous optimization based onÂ real-time data. Timeline and Support:  The implementation time isÂ upÂ toÂ 6Â months, including planning, development, testing, and monitoring phases (+6Â months inÂ addition). Post-launch, the chatbot will undergo regular updates based onÂ user feedback and data insights toÂ ensure itÂ meets ongoing humanitarian needs. Impact:  This chatbot will enhance access toÂ humanitarian aid information for Ukrainians, supporting transparency, fraud prevention, and efficient resource navigation, and will play aÂ vital role inÂ the humanitarian response led byÂ the Emergency Telecommunications Cluster (ETC) and partners. Responsibilities: Chatbot Development and Architecture: Design and implement aÂ secure chatbot platform using  Django (Python)  orÂ  Node.js , ensuring scalability toÂ support 200,000Â users. Develop aÂ one-way communication interface tailored for efficient information dissemination and anti-fraud messaging. Ensure compliance with WFP and humanitarian principles and guidelines, focusing onÂ aÂ user-friendly, accessible interface. User Interface and Accessibility: Create aÂ chatbot interface that isÂ intuitive, accessible, and inclusive ofÂ users with disabilities (e.g., voice speaker options, and special text). Implement language support for Ukrainian and English, ensuring localization and context relevance for Ukrainian users. Provide options for text and voice interaction toÂ accommodate different user needs and preferences. Backend and Database Management: Set upÂ and manage aÂ scalable  PostgreSQL  database hosted onÂ AWS, with automated backup and disaster recovery. Optimize the backend toÂ handle high traffic, monitor performance, and integrate anÂ analytics dashboard toÂ track user behavior and chatbot effectiveness. Security and Data Protection: Implement robust security measures, including data encryption (AES-256), role-based access control (RBAC) toÂ CMS, and multi-factor authentication (MFA) toÂ CMS. Ensure secure API integration with Telegram and Viber for messaging, implementing rate limiting and DDoS protection. APIÂ Integration: Integrate with  Telegram  and  Viber  APIs toÂ facilitate platform accessibility and efficient information sharing. Implement Google TTS orÂ similar services for voice responses toÂ enhance accessibility for users who may prefer audio content. Content Management System (CMS): Develop aÂ CMS with aÂ user-friendly, WYSIWYG interface, allowing non-technical staff toÂ manage content without altering the system code. Set upÂ role-based access control within the CMS toÂ limit content updates toÂ authorized personnel only. Monitoring, Analytics, and Reporting: Set upÂ real-time monitoring using AWS CloudWatch, tracking system performance, user interactions, and traffic patterns. Develop anÂ analytical dashboard toÂ track user behavior, chatbot interactions, and key metrics, integrating insights for potential future database integration. Testing, Rollout, and Maintenance: Define and execute testing phases, including user acceptance and bug resolution. Develop aÂ demo and assist inÂ the rollout process, implementing updates and improvements based onÂ user feedback and analytics. Provide training for super users onÂ content management and dashboard usage. Offer ongoing support for maintenance, ensuring regular updates and adjustments toÂ meet user needs. Requirements: Technical Skills:  Expertise inÂ Django orÂ Node.js, PostgreSQL, AWS, Docker, API integration (Telegram, Viber), and Google TTS. Security Expertise:  Strong knowledge ofÂ secure coding practices, encryption, and access control mechanisms. Project Management:  Proven ability toÂ independently manage the end-to-end project, meeting milestones within aÂ  6-month  timeline. Communication Skills:  Excellent documentation and training capabilities toÂ support non-technical users.
